intro: Pimelea sericea, commonly known as silky pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The plant produces silky, white to greyish hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and shrublands. Pimelea sericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
